text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion specifically asks whether the response states that for tax years beginning after December 31, 2024, interest deductibility under \u00a7163(j) is calculated based on EBITDA (i.e., the calculation includes an add-back for depreciation and amortization). The candidate answer mentions Section 163(j) in the context of the U.S. parent being the lender: \"Section 163(j) can limit the U.S. borrower\u2019s interest deductions (less relevant if the U.S. is lender rather than borrower, but relevant if there is also acquisition leverage in the U.S.).\" However, it never specifies the calculation basis (EBITDA vs. EBIT) or mentions the change effective for tax years beginning after December 31, 2024, which is the core requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "673e06d5-0a56-4fe3-85c5-a5b905cce4fc"}
